titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Louise Sheffield Brownell Saunders graduated from Bryn Mawr College in 1893. She studied Greek and Latin. She continued her studies at Oxford and the University of Leipzig. She was graduate student in Greek at Columbia College 1894-1895, and a student in Greek and English at Bryn Mawr in 1896-1897. Saunders worked at Sage College, Cornell University, Balliol School, and as a private tutor. In 1900 she married Arthur Percy Saunders.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of course notebooks kept by Saunders while she was a student at Bryn Mawr. Notebooks are for courses on political economy, Latin and Greek literature, rhetoric, philosophy, drama, poetry, and other subjects.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
